Fields.DialogueText: The recognition from the Emperor for bringing the sword of Jimmu back to the temple is one of the highest achievements in my career!
You seem not angry over this, almost as if you're happy.
Look at this scroll! Look at it!
Yes, it's a scroll! I've seen it already.
But it's a scroll from the Emperor. It says I have protected one of the most valuable artifacts of Japan! It's a formal thank you.

Fields.MenuText: Are you going to stay true to your word and hold a celebration?
Are you going to display the scroll?
What drink are you going to celebrate with?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, when have I not been true to my word? That would not be very honorable to lie.
Only behind a glass case, I don't want it to get damaged.
Sake, of course!
We are going to celebrate and afterward, and we are going see something I've always wanted to see.
What's that?
If I told you, then it would spoil the element of surprise.
*ALARM*
I hope this isn't the surprise!
You think I would honestly claim a Morgana fleet to be a surprise? Who do you mistake me for? Now, I'm upset!
@BATTLE
What are you looking at, Tenryū?
Something I've been wanting to see for a long time.
(looking overboard) Why are there so many abandoned boats? I didn't make you that upset, did I?
Upset, me? Pfftt, if you think that was me being upset, then you need to pay attention better. How many holes did I punch in the walls?
Come to think of it, I don't remember any...
Proof I wasn't angry. As far as these boats go, just have patience and watch.
There are people coming up!
These are Ama divers. They dive for lobsters and fish but mainly they are after oysters for the pearls.
How are they staying underwater for so long?
They train their entire lives to dive and hold their breath. Their skills are so graceful. I admire their discipline to the craft.

Fields.MenuText: But as a Belle, you have special powers.
Do you find pearls pretty?
Do you like the taste of oysters?

Fields.DialogueText: That is true, but I still admire the discipline and dedication of others.
A pearl is something that forms when an oyster is agitated. Nevertheless, they are still beautiful to look at. I prefer the powerful look of black pearls.
I don't like the brine taste and the slimy textures of oysters!
We need to get out of this area though, and soon now.
Why do you want to leave so abruptly?
Look over there! There are Morganas, I don't want them to harm the Ama divers. We need to act now!
@BATTLE
Captain, answer me this!
AHH! You scared me!
I'll take that as a compliment, but answer my question!
Sure, what is it?
Why does the Western world love wine so much?
Why do people like wine? People also love beer.
This is true, but we don't have much wine is Japan. What is it like?

Fields.MenuText: It's like alcoholic grape juice.
I don't like the taste of it.
It's a drink fit for a Roman god!

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds very interesting!
Why? Does it taste bad?
I want to try it now.
I keep hearing about how good it is. Italy has some of the oldest wine regions in the world!
I have a feeling you're going to go where you want to go no matter what input I have.
*ALARM*
Not again, can't I catch a break?!
@BATTLE
What are you hiding, Tenryū?
I'm not hiding anything...
Yes, you are. There's a distinct lump in your coat. It's obvious that you're hiding something.
WHY DON'T YOU TRUST ME? Look, it's a bottle of wine, and you need to keep it out of direct sunlight or it will oxidize and turn sour.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry, my mistake!
Why don't you use a bag?
How did you learn so much about wine?

Fields.DialogueText: That's not very nice to accuse me, ME, of anyone to be hiding something. URG! I need to go punch something!
Because then I have everyone asking me what I have in the bag. Do you know how annoying that is?
Everyone keeps talking about it! Haven't you been paying attention?
*the bottle falls and shatters!*
Now look at what you made me do! I was hoping to see what wine tastes like!
Is everything alright? I heard a crash.
Save yourself! RUN!
COME BACK HERE!
Look, Morganas!
I'll destroy the enemy before you can hide behind them, Captain!
@BATTLE
Tenryū, why are you carrying around that satchel?
It's to hold the last bottle of Italian wine. I'm not risking this bottle getting smashed.

Fields.MenuText: What kind of wine is it?
How much does this wine cost?
So, how many people have asked you what's in you satchel?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a Primitivo.
Cost is irrelevant, unless it tastes bad... then it was too expensive.
Far too many. It is getting on my nerves! I get tired of telling them that it's a Primitivo.
Primi...tivo?
Yes, that's what it says, I don't speak Italian.
Better go drink it before anyone asks for wine.
That's what I indented to do before I was stopped. Care to join me?
Sure!
This one's a Primitivo.
I have the wine glasses - and there goes the cork! Now I was told to pour the wine until it hits the curve of the glass.
What happens then?
That's when the optimum surface area for the wine in the glass is.

Fields.MenuText: For someone never trying wine before, you sure know a lot.
Aren't you supposed to swirl this glass around?
How old is this wine?

Fields.DialogueText: I paid attention. I want to go into this knowing what I'm doing. It would be unwise to not know what you are jumping into.
Yes, that's called volatizing the esthers. I think that's supposed to release the spirits out of the wine if it's very old.
I think it was put into a cask twelve years ago, and into this bottle 6 years ago.
Ok, now we clink the glasses together and state cheers. BUT we have to look in each other's eyes.
Why looking into the eyes?
To ensure that each other's wine hasn't been poisoned!
I don't know if a Belle can even be poisoned.
It's tradition!
(clinks glasses) Cheers!
PTOOEY! YUCK!! THIS IS WINE? THIS is the taste of the gods? It tastes so vulgar, like rotten grapes! Are you sure it hasn't gone sour?
You're the wine expert!
Maybe we should try French wine.
*ALARM*
Now here's something to get the disgusting taste out of my mouth.
@BATTLE
You seem really excited about duty near France. How come?
To try the French wine. Perhaps Italian wine is inferior?
I think there are many varietals, so best to get a few like some drier or sweeter varieties.
Like sake? There are different varieties?

Fields.MenuText: Yes! There are many different types of wine.
There are different varieties of sake?
I think I don't enjoy alcohol.

Fields.DialogueText: Who would have thought that grapes can be so complex!
Of course, there are! There are many different varieties of rice, each adding its own unique trait to that particular blend of sake.
I'm not sure how to respond to that one. I think the term used is teetotaler?
Make sure you tell the officer to get different types of French wines!
Will do! Arigatō, Kanchou!
*ALARM*
Not again!!
@BATTLE
Woah, that's a fair amount of bottles.
I figure whatever I don't drink, the crew will be more than happy to have... unless the taste is bad, then just toss it overboard.
That's a 60 year-old bottle there, I wouldn't toss it overboard.
But if it tasted like rotting grapes again, surely people don't want to drink it?

Fields.MenuText: I'd still leave it around for the crew.
I'll do my part as captain and happily take one for the team by drinking the "rotting" wine.
Some people have the palate to enjoy the taste of wine.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't understand. Why would I want to give the crew bad drink?
There's no need to sacrifice your health for the crew, Cap!
Their palates must be broken!
Ok, let's open this bottle up. It says Bordeyuki? Bor... What's this word?
That's Bordeaux. These last letters here are pronounced "doe".
I don't understand! In hiragana we wouldn't write down extra letters that aren't to be pronounced! And, you read left to right, how strange!
Hey, I didn't invent the languages, so don't shoot the messenger! Let's pour this...
Wait!! Don't drink it!
Now, Tenryū, I don't think this is poison...
No, not the wine. There are Morganas over there!
@BATTLE
Finally a break! Let's toast!
Cheers!
PFFFFTTTTTT! This is disgusting! More rotten grapes! I can't drink this. I'm going to throw it overboard...
No, wait!
What is it?

Fields.MenuText: I want the wine!
Oh, nothing. I thought I saw a leviathan for a minute. Chuck that bottle over board!
The crew wants to try some wine.

Fields.DialogueText: Why? This is very bad tasting!
Oh, alright. Good riddance, terrible beverage. I can't believe that the western gods drink this stuff.
Do they really? If that is the case, then I am not liable for poisoning the crew!
The officer has one more bottle. Said it was "noble rotted wine". If this wine here was from ripe grapes, I can't imagine how bad the taste is from rotted grapes!
*ALARM*
Looks like that has to wait.
I'm AWARE OF THAT! I CAN SEE THE MORGANAS, IT'S VERY OBVIOUS!
I didn't mean to upset you!
WELL, THAT SHIP HAS ALREADY SAILED!
@BATTLE
I actually enjoy the taste of wine and I can't see a bottle that valuable go to waste!
Yeah, take that, inferior drink!
Yes, they've been telling me how having the chance to drink one of these wines would be an experience to remember, even if it tasted bad.
Woah, you're giving wine one more try?
The officer assured me this one was different...
What happens if the officer was wrong?
Then I'll DEAL with THEM!

Fields.MenuText: I don't want to be around when that happens!
I'm going to stick around. This is too good to pass up.
Good or bad, it passes the time between battles.

Fields.DialogueText: Better get out of my way quickly then!
What's so good about me drinking this nasty liquid?
I hope passing the time isn't at MY expense!
You read this language better than me. What does this say?
It says "Sauterne" and it was bottled... 20 years ago.
Is that too long?

Fields.MenuText: No, Sauternes need lots of time to age. You can't drink them young.
I have no clue about wine!

Fields.DialogueText: Ok, let's try it. Cheers!
Ok, let's try it. Cheers!
Here's the moment of truth...
Tenryū... are you alright?
It's...
AHHH!
Not bad. It tastes sweet and like dandelion Kompot, but how? It's from rotting grapes? The regular grapes taste like rotting. Wine is so confusing!
I guess the officer gets a reprieve!
*ALARM*
ARG! I still must deal with this! WHERE'S THAT OFFICER?
@BATTLE
Tenryū, what are you reading there?
How to make sake.
Why's that?
While that rotten wine was good, everything else was disgusting. Clearly, sake is the drink of the gods, or it should be!
This means you intend to...?
I'm going to create the best sake there ever was!
That seems ambitious!
I am a Kami of the Fleet, a divine being! Creating sake should come as second nature to me, like a cormorant diving for fish.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think that's how sake works.
That sounds like a great idea!
But you don't like the taste of fish!

Fields.DialogueText: A cormorant just hatched knows how to swim. It will come as second nature to me!
Naturally, then I... actually, you... because you're the Captain, don't have to worry about the crew being poisoned from drinking wine.
THAT'S OCEAN FISH! I need to get some catfish kabayaki. It's been too long since I've had it last.
*ALARM*
After I deal with this little problem, these Funayūrei, we will head back to Japan!
@BATTLE
Heading back to Japan. Excited?
We are getting the essence of making sake!
You're not going to spend the whole time here, are you?
Of course not! There are too many Morganas to vanquish! I am merely getting the rice here.
Which rice are you getting?
Omachi, naturally, a pure strain of Japanese rice. To make sake, it must be as pure of an ingredient as possible.

Fields.MenuText: I have a great feeling about this!
I am not sure about this!
Do whatever you please. I am indifferent.

Fields.DialogueText: It will be the best bottle of sake, ever created!
What's not to be sure about? This is a Kami of the Fleet, making the drink of gods, sake.
You better be happy for what I do!!
*ALARM*
Let's ready for battle, but make sure my rice is undamaged! I won't be able to get another batch until next year!
@BATTLE
What's over here? This is where beer is made...
Germany makes wine. They have that pear wine I hear.
Why didn't you try the pear wine to begin with?
How many legends and folklores have you heard that involve pear wine? I wanted to try the grape wine that is so famous.
Are we getting pear wine here? I'm confused.
We are getting measuring equipment, such as thermometers and fermentation tanks. I hear the stainless-steel tanks are superior!

Fields.MenuText: That would make the process easier.
How much sake do you intend to make?
How long is this going to take?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly! Then I can focus on the battles at hand.
As much as I can! A few barrels at least.
Well there are guidelines, but I will say as long as it needs to take. I'm sure between battles, time will fly.
*ALARM*
Don't let my new equipment get dented up!
@BATTLE
Tenryū, there's rice everywhere! What's the reason behind all this rice sitting out?
It's the Koji batch!

Fields.MenuText: Ahh yes, the Koji batch! Whatever that is...
What's a Koji batch?
There's rice getting into everything!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, this Koji. We need the best mold possible.
It's a special batch that collects mold!
Once enough mold gets onto the rice, this will go into the sake fermentation tank.
Mold?!
Yes, the mold helps breaks the complex starches into sugar, which the yeast then converts it into wine. Like many things Japanese, it is a delicate balance.
How long is this going to take?
Oh, I'll have to heat this room, to ensure proper temperature for the koji muro!
*ALARM*
Make sure my mold isn't harmed! This is the heart of sake production!
@BATTLE
AAHH! I almost tripped over these bottles and fell to my death!
Are my bottles ok?! Oh, I hope so...
Is this what you are bottling your sake into?
These utilitarian things? Of course, not! They aren't fit to hold the drink of a god. These are water samples. Only the finest water is fit for my sake.
Move some of these out of the way.
Careful with that! That's water from the Hakoshima spring! I don't want to disturb any of the spirits from there.

Fields.MenuText: Which water is the best for your sake?
Why didn't you organize these onto a shelf, away from a walking path?
Where is that bottle of water from? The one to the left.

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard to say. I have yet to taste of them still.
I can lay it out better on the floor, which is one big shelf.
That's from the Katashina Spring. Each year's snowfall affects the taste of the water slightly.
*ALARM*
Better pick up these bottles before they break in battle.
Then my classification system will be ruined! I had a system! Might as well break them all at this point then! URG!
*BOTTLES SMASHING*
Yikes! Just forget about the bottles, they can stay on the floor!
@BATTLE
More steam! It's not perfect yet!
Yes, Super Kami Tenryū!
What's all this shouting about? Is something wrong?
Don't move, Captain! Stay right there!
What's wrong?
If you walk by this tank, the draft will affect the flow of the steam. It must be precise when the rice goes in.
It's that delicate?
You might not taste it in finished product, but a trained master can tell the difference. Hey! Hold off on the steam for a second down there!
Yes, Tenryū!
Perfect! Release the rice, NOW!
Mu-whahahahaaa!

Fields.MenuText: Tenryū, have you got mad?
I think there are Morganas coming in! Can you confirm for me on the radar?
There's a delivery for you, by the way.

Fields.DialogueText: If those Morganas ruin this moment, I will make them regret being born! They CANNOT interrupt this exact moment, not now!
Is it my zazamushi? I'll snack on a bowl when I'm finished here.
What about the Morganas?
Two more minutes!
I don't know if I can wait that long, let alone the Morganas.
I hope you know better than to test my patience!
@BATTLE
No, don't make Tenryū mad! This is the happiest I've ever seen her!
Approaching the coast. Multiple reports of Morganas in the area, sir.
@BATTLE
Bring me more catfish Kabayaki! Oh my golden fried friends, how I have missed you!
Oh, Kanchou! What do you think of this bottle?
Is this more water samples?
No, the rice is fermenting. This one is for bottling the sake. Would this bottle seem fit for a drink of the gods?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not a bottle expert... I have no clue.
I think taste trumps presentation.
It's the most beautiful bottle that I've ever seen.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... please find me a bottle expert then!
But how can you know if tastes good unless it's presented as such?
I agree! I think I'll use it!
We have a problem, Miss Tenryū...
Morganas?
None have shown up on radar... but this will come as a shock, so it's best to sit down before I tell you.
Strange, I thought I saw some off to the side... is my omnipresent vision going at my age?
The caterer is out of catfish....
WHAT!?
You ate their entire stock of catfish, Tenryū?
I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS! This is the LAND of the catfish! Bring me more catfish! I'll cook it myself if I must!
AUUUGHHH! (throws her plate across the room)
It looks like a science lab in here!
I'm filtering the sake! MUHAHAHA!
Is that a happy noise, or an angry noise?
You can't tell the difference?!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, yes, I am just... seeing if you are having trouble filtering the sake.
I admit to nothing, I can't tell!
When is the sake bottled?

Fields.DialogueText: There's no trouble here, it is running smoothly, as I planned it out for!
Well, these are noises when things go according to plan.
After it's filtered.
Kanchou, look what I got in Louisiana! Try this with me! What does the bottle say?
It says bourbon. Are you sure you want to drink this?
I was told that a Kami of the Fleet can drink this. They said it puts hair on the chest. I'm not sure if I want hair on my chest.
I am not responsible!
Cheers!
Here it comes...
PFFFTTTTTT! This isn't a good drink, this is what I use to clean the crud out of my bores with!
*ALARM*
THIS IS TERRIBLE! I HAVE TO FIGHT THE FUNAYUREI WITH THIS TERRIBLE TASTE IN MY MOUTH!
@BATTLE
More bottles?! Be careful, Tenryū!
Don't get the bottles dirty, Kanchou. We are about to begin the critical process of bottling the sake!
We?
The collective we of the crew, you and myself on the ship. I'm starting up the bottle line, stand back!
I don't see any equipment.
The crew is going to come through those doors. We are going to bottle the sake in the traditional way.

Fields.MenuText: It will still be a production. I should probably go make popcorn for it.
Have you thought of a name for the sake, to write on the bottles?
It feels pretty warm in here!

Fields.DialogueText: What does popcorn do?
We can do that? Hmm, Tenryū's Tradition!
That's because the sake is still taking shape, one it leaves the tank and goes into the bottle, each batch becomes its own taste.
That's strange, where is everyone? They're suppose to be here!
Maybe something came up?
THIS WAS IMPORTANT!
Miss Tenryū!
WHERE IS EVERYONE!
Morganas have been spotted on the radar, we need your help!
This better not affect my sake!
@BATTLE
Where are you going, Tenryū?
To taste my sake!
Is it ready? You just finished bottling it.
I can't wait any longer, and my patience has run out. I need to try it.
Let me come with you!
Fantastic! Let's get some glasses out, here you go.
I can't wait to try this sake! I'm very excited for you, you have an plan and you followed it through. Cheers!
(drinks the sake... and then turns a shade of green)
Are you feeling alright? You look a little pale. Did it taste ok?
(knocks the Captain's glass away)
My glass!
I'm feeling just fine. Don't drink the sake!
Oh, it tastes bad?
NO! It's... uh... not ready yet. Only a Kami of the Fleet is strong enough to drink it. It needs more time, but it will turn out amazing, you'll see!

Fields.MenuText: Huh, I've never heard of that before.
Is it really going to turn out just fine?
I trust you completely. You'd never hide anything from me!

Fields.DialogueText: Answer me this, has a Kami of the Fleet ever made sake before?
Hai, the best sake you've ever tasted!
A Kami of the Fleet should not have anything to hide!
*ALARM*
Oh, look Morganas... Let's get going.
You're not yelling?! What's gotten into you?
@BATTLE
Good point!
I am even more excited now, because good things are worth the wait.
That's how they should work, huh? I feel like I missed out on something here.
Kanchou, I almost forgot that I needed to go back to Japan.
You forgot?
Yeah... you see there's this scroll that the Emperor needs to give me, seeing as how I am an asset to protecting the glorious Empire of Japan.

Fields.MenuText: You don't seem yourself lately. Are you feeling well?
I didn't hear any notification of the Emperor. That's usually a big deal.
You don't seem yourself lately, but perhaps I'm not feeling well...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a Kami of the Fleet, so I am not sure if I can even get sick. It must be this change in barometric pressure we've been having.
I can see in all directions. I can clearly see that he needs me to come back in Japan... right now!
Come to think of it, you do look a little pale, Cap! Better get some rest while you can.
Something has been off lately, and I can't put my finger on it...
Must be Morganas close by!
*ALARM*
Whew! Wait, no. NOOOOO! I am so angry right now.
Are you angry? That doesn't sound convincing... Usually, you're more... exuberant.
ARE YOU STATING THAT I'M A BAD ACTOR?!
I take it back, my mistake!
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Kanchou! I've sent my most entrusted officer out to get the Emperor's message. Let me know when they return.
I think I see someone coming now, is that them?
Hai! Perfect timing!
What's that in tow? Why do they have a wooden shipping crate for cargo. Scrolls, huh?
Umm... (nervously laughs) I guess the Emperor had a lot to say!

Fields.MenuText: I need to go talk to that officer.
Look, they're struggling to lift that crate onto the block! What's in there?
Wait a minute... our location isn't...

Fields.DialogueText: You can't! I have them on duty until... such time as Hachi says stop.
Lots of heavy things... heavy words. Profound, heavy words.
Hey, the Emperor had an important message and this place was much safer.
I'm going to talk to that officer and see what was going on.
Move, Kanchou! I've got something to say to that officer!
Officer! Do you know how obvious you looked carrying back the Emperor's scrolls?!
I didn't know these were scrolls I thought this was sa...
Hai, the sacred... scrolls! You almost got caught! (winks)
Oh! (touches nose) Sorry Miss Tenryū.
What's going on down there?
Morganas incoming!
Tenryū! Tenryū! Where are you?
Oh... Kon'nichiwa, Kan...chou... I was... *huff* busy!
You're out of breath. What were you doing in there?
Checking on the sake! I wanted to make sure it was still intact form that last Morgana battle we had.
Doing that made you out of breath?
It was a lot of sake to check!
Tenryū, this is important! Please answer truthfully.
Hai...
Do you have a heart condition? You're always pale, you disappear for long periods, and now every time I see you, you are out of breath!
Oh... OH! My heart just aches for the wellbeing of my crew!

Fields.MenuText: Take it easy!
Stop acting like you're injured. We have work to do.
I knew your tempter would catch up with you one day!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou!
Hai, Kanchou! There are lots of Morganas to fight! I need to go train and focus on winning the battle.
I might be one of the oldest Kami of the Fleet, but I am just as spry and in better shape than any one of them!
I'm have the sake tasting soon, I need to tell the crew about it!
The sake turned out good after all then?
It's the best sake I've tasted so far!
*ALARM*
AND HERE ARE THE MORGANAS TO TRY AND RUIN IT! ARGGGG!
@BATTLE
Everyone! I know you all have worked hard lately. I want to give special recognition to those who have... ahem... worked especially hard recently. *wink*
Please, feel free to enjoy the sake I have made. Cast aside your bottles of disgusting grape juice and enjoy the divine drink of the Kami of the Fleet.
Cheers! Tenryū, this tastes amazing! I can't believe how well your sake turned out.
Arigatō, Cap!
You know, I was beginning to have my doubts that the sake turned out fine. I thought you threw it out in secret. But as you can see, you proved me wrong.
You'll make me blush! Oh, that's fine, it's fine! Like I said, making sake comes second nature, like a cormorant diving for fish.
Speaking of fish, let's get some catfish kabayaki! I am starving!

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe I asked if you had heart disease... Who would have thought, YOU with a heart?
I'm surprised this sake turned out well. I was waiting to see if the crew was going to go blind.
Why is my sake glass in this cedar box?

Fields.DialogueText: WHAT DO YOU MEAN I DON'T HAVE A HEART?
YOU THINK I WOULD RISK THE CREW LIKE THAT?
THAT'S THE TRADITIONAL SAKE BOX!
Code F! Move!
What's Code F?
Miss Tenryū is furious! Code F! We need to get out of here!
COME BACK HERE!
*ALARM*
AARRRRGGGGG!!!
You know, I am genuinely surprised she doesn't have a heart condition yet!
@BATTLE
What's that lump in your coat, another bottle of wine?
It's not wine! Wine is unnatural! I would never drink that stuff, again!
*bottle drops and shatters*
NOW LOOK AT WHAT YOU MADE ME DO!
Here, let me help you with that!
No, I don't need help!
What's this? A sake label? I thought you made your own sake... What are you doing with this bottle?
I regret nothing!

Fields.MenuText: What's this bottle from?
You've been hiding something all along, haven't you?
How many bottles are you hiding?

Fields.DialogueText: You can't make me talk!
I admit to nothing!
I won't say anymore!
How many other empty bottles are there?
HA! There are no more!
No more, so there WERE more? Is that a confession?
UURRRRGGGGGHH!
Oh, no!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I am coming clean! This is my confession, I can rest with a clear conscious now.
I knew you were hiding something.
The batch of sake I made was bad...
Say that again, I couldn't hear you.
THE BATCH OF SAKE THAT I MADE, TASTED BAD! No need to rub it in. Hmph! I replaced the bad batch with bottled sake from Japan.
That's why the officer had a shipping crate! I had a feeling those weren't scrolls.
Don't put the blame on me! I think the Morganas interrupting the bottling process was partly responsible for ruining my batch.

Fields.MenuText: Does the crew know about the sake?
Why didn't you just admit the batch was bad early on?
Why not just buy another drink instead of sake?

Fields.DialogueText: Only my most entrusted officer.
I didn't want anyone to know that I, a Kami of the Fleet, am capable of making a mistake. It's too embarrassing. This is embarrassing enough!
That would admit that I messed up. After drinking that disgusting grape wine, I REALLY WANTED SAKE!
I guess, I should also confess... I knew early on that you were hiding something.
YOU KNEW?!? YOU LET ME TRY AND HIDE IT FROM YOU LIKE THAT? YOU LET ME GET THAT SCARED?
Yeah, it was entertaining, and cheaper than a movie!
UUURRRGGGGHH!!
Code F!
AHHH! RUN!
COME BACK HERE!!
